Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of Ukraine's donations to the Clinton Foundation by stating that it donated the most cash of any country.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that Ukraine donated the most cash to the Clinton Foundation.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the donations mentioned in the Wall Street Journal article were made by the Ukrainian government, when in fact they were made by an individual donor.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Ukrainian government did not donate to the Clinton Foundation, as confirmed by a spokesman for the foundation.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misrepresenting the 2015 Wall Street Journal report and drawing incorrect conclusions from it.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the high amount of donations from Ukraine, which is attributed to the contributions of a single individual, Victor Pinchuk.
